definitions: wrongful or criminal deception intended to result in financial or personal gain
person who pretends to be something they are not to gain advantage
examples: The company was accused of committing fraud against investors
Tax fraud carries heavy penalties including imprisonment
He turned out to be a fraud with fake credentials
The psychic was exposed as a complete fraud

definitions: worn or unraveled edge of fabric or rope showing loose threads
noisy fight or conflict between people or groups
examples: The fray at the carpet's edge needed immediate repair
Her sweater showed considerable fray after years of wear
Several players joined the fray after the initial scuffle
He decided to stay above the political fray

definitions: person or thing that is markedly unusual or abnormal
highly unusual and unexpected event or situation
person extremely enthusiastic about a particular interest or activity
examples: The circus featured various human freaks in sideshows
He was considered a freak for his unusual appearance
The storm was a freak of nature never seen before
The accident was a complete freak that couldn't be predicted
She's a fitness freak who exercises three times daily
My brother is a total control freak about everything

definitions: person who has been freed from slavery especially in historical contexts
examples: The freedman struggled to find work after the Civil War
Many freedmen settled in northern cities seeking opportunity

definitions: power or right to act, speak, or think without hindrance or restraint
particular right or privilege to do something without restriction
examples: The constitution guarantees freedom to all citizens equally
Many people fought bravely for their freedom from oppression
Freedom of speech remains a fundamental democratic principle
The press enjoys considerable freedom in democratic societies

definitions: permanent and absolute ownership of land or property with freedom to dispose of it
examples: They purchased the freehold rather than continuing to lease
The freehold includes both the building and surrounding land

definitions: person who owns freehold property or land
examples: The freeholder refused to sell despite multiple generous offers
As a freeholder, she had complete control over the property

definitions: act of making someone or something free from confinement, control, or restriction
examples: The freeing of the hostages required delicate diplomatic negotiations
Her freeing from addiction took years of dedicated effort

definitions: working for different companies at different times rather than being permanently employed
examples: She does freelance graphic design for various tech startups
His freelance writing provides a comfortable supplementary income

definitions: person who works freelance rather than being permanently employed by one company
examples: The freelancer submitted invoices for three completed projects
Many freelancers struggle with irregular income and benefits

definitions: person who is not a slave and has full rights of citizenship
examples: Every freeman could vote in the ancient Greek democracy
The freeman enjoyed privileges denied to serfs and slaves

definitions: international fraternal organization with secret ceremonies and rituals promoting brotherhood and charity
examples: His grandfather was deeply involved in local freemasonry activities
Freemasonry has influenced architecture and symbolism throughout history

definitions: fine-grained stone that can be cut easily in any direction without splitting
examples: The cathedral was constructed entirely from locally quarried freestone
Freestone allows intricate carved details impossible with harder materials

definitions: swimming stroke where any style may be used, typically the front crawl
performance or competition with few restrictions on technique or form
examples: She won gold in the hundred meter freestyle event
His freestyle technique improved dramatically with professional coaching
The rapper's freestyle impressed everyone at the battle
Freestyle skiing allows creative expression through aerial tricks

definitions: computer software that is available free of charge for unlimited use
examples: The company offers freeware versions of their professional tools
Many students rely on freeware for their computing needs

definitions: controlled-access highway designed for high-speed traffic with no traffic signals or intersections
examples: The freeway connects the city center to suburban areas
Traffic on the freeway moved slowly during rush hour

definitions: state of being frozen solid or the act of freezing
fixing of prices, wages, or spending at a particular level
period of very cold weather when temperatures remain below freezing
examples: The sudden freeze damaged many tropical plants overnight
Put the meat in the freeze compartment immediately
The government announced a freeze on public sector hiring
The wage freeze lasted for eighteen difficult months
The freeze is expected to continue through next week
Farmers worried about their crops during the unexpected freeze

definitions: appliance or compartment that freezes food and keeps it frozen for storage
examples: The freezer needs defrosting after six months of use
She stocked the freezer with meals for the month

definitions: temperature at which liquid turns to solid, especially water to ice
process or act of turning liquid into solid through cold temperature
examples: Water reaches freezing at thirty-two degrees Fahrenheit precisely
The freezing of the lake happens gradually each winter
The freezing of assets prevented the criminal from fleeing
Quick freezing preserves the nutritional value of vegetables

definitions: goods transported in bulk by truck, train, ship, or aircraft
charge for transporting goods commercially from one place to another
examples: The freight arrived damaged after rough handling during shipping
Railway freight remains crucial for transporting heavy industrial materials
The freight on overseas shipments has increased significantly
We need to calculate freight before finalizing the price

definitions: large ship or aircraft designed to carry goods rather than passengers
examples: The freighter departed with containers bound for Asian ports
Several freighters waited in the harbor for loading permits

definitions: state of uncontrolled excitement or wild behavior often affecting a group
examples: The announcement sent fans into an absolute buying frenzy
Media frenzy surrounded the celebrity's unexpected arrest yesterday

definitions: rate at which something occurs or is repeated over time
particular waveband at which radio signals are broadcast or received
examples: The frequency of earthquakes has increased in recent years
She noted the frequency of his visits with suspicion
The radio station broadcasts on a frequency of 101.5
Different frequencies carry different television and radio channels

definitions: painting done rapidly in watercolor on wet plaster on a wall or ceiling
examples: The Renaissance fresco depicts scenes from classical mythology
Restoration of the ancient fresco required specialized conservation techniques

definitions: first-year student at a university or college, especially in British usage
examples: The fresher struggled to find her way around campus
Freshers' week includes orientation activities and social events

definitions: student in the first year of high school or university
examples: The freshman nervously entered the crowded university lecture hall
Freshman orientation helps new students adjust to college life

definitions: water that is not salty, especially found in rivers and lakes
examples: Freshwater fish cannot survive in ocean saltwater environments
The lake provides freshwater for the surrounding agricultural region

definitions: metal ridge on the fingerboard of a guitar or similar instrument
ornamental design of repeated geometric patterns used in architecture or decoration
examples: The guitarist pressed the string against the third fret
Worn frets affect the instrument's intonation and playability
The Greek fret pattern adorned the ancient temple's borders
Victorian houses often feature decorative fret work details

definitions: ornamental design in wood typically with a pattern of interlacing lines
examples: The Victorian porch featured intricate fretwork along its edges
Skilled craftsmen created the delicate fretwork using traditional tools

definitions: member of certain religious orders of men especially the four mendicant orders
examples: The friar devoted his life to helping the poor
Medieval friars traveled between towns preaching and teaching

definitions: building or community where friars live together under religious vows
examples: The medieval friary ruins attract thousands of tourists annually
He spent three years living in a remote mountain friary

definitions: consonant sound made by forcing breath through a narrow opening creating friction
examples: The English 'f' and 'v' sounds are examples of fricatives
Spanish has fewer fricative sounds than English does

definitions: resistance encountered when one body moves relative to another body with which it is in contact
conflict or disagreement between people with different views or beliefs
examples: Friction between the brake pads stops the wheel effectively
Oil reduces friction between moving engine parts significantly
Growing friction between departments threatened overall company productivity
Political friction increased as the election date approached

definitions: appliance for keeping food and drinks cold and fresh
examples: The fridge needs cleaning after the power outage yesterday
She found expired milk hidden behind items in the fridge

definitions: person whom one knows and has a bond of mutual affection
examples: My best friend has supported me through difficult times
She made many friends during her university years abroad

definitions: game or match played for practice rather than as part of a competition
examples: The team scheduled a friendly before the tournament began
International friendlies help teams prepare for major competitions

definitions: state of being friends with mutual affection and support between people
examples: Their friendship survived despite years of physical distance
True friendship requires trust, loyalty, and mutual respect

definitions: broad horizontal band of sculpted or painted decoration especially on a wall
examples: The ancient temple's frieze depicted battles between gods
A decorative frieze ran along the dining room ceiling

definitions: warship designed for speed and maneuverability, smaller than a destroyer
examples: The naval frigate patrolled international waters for pirates
Modern frigates carry sophisticated missile defense systems onboard

definitions: sudden intense feeling of fear or shock from danger or surprise
examples: The loud explosion gave everyone a terrible fright
She recovered quickly from her initial fright and took action

definitions: strip of cloth or paper gathered along one edge as decoration
unnecessary extra feature or embellishment added to something
examples: The dress had delicate frills around the collar and sleeves
Victorian fashion featured elaborate frills and lace details
The basic model comes without any frills or extras
We need practical solutions without unnecessary frills attached

definitions: decorative border of threads or tassels attached to an edge
outer edge or margin of an area, group, or activity
unconventional or peripheral part of a group or activity
examples: The curtains had a gold fringe along the bottom edge
Her jacket featured leather fringe in Western style
They lived on the fringe of the city limits
The park sits on the northern fringe of town
The fringe of the political party held radical views
Fringe theater groups perform experimental works downtown

definitions: quick search of a person's clothing and body for weapons or contraband
examples: Airport security conducted a frisk after the metal detector alarm
The police frisk was challenged as unconstitutional in court

definitions: woman's or girl's dress, typically of a traditional or formal style
examples: She wore a simple cotton frock to the garden party
The vintage frock featured intricate embroidered details throughout

definitions: tailless amphibian with smooth skin and long hind legs for jumping
ornamental fastening for a coat consisting of a looped braid
examples: The pond frog caught flies with its sticky tongue
Tree frogs chirped loudly throughout the tropical night
The military uniform featured brass frogs down the front
Each frog fastener was carefully hand-sewn onto the coat

definitions: lively and playful activity or movement expressing joy and high spirits
examples: Children's frolic in the snow delighted their watching parents
The puppies engaged in endless frolic throughout the afternoon

definitions: large leaf especially of a palm, fern, or similar plant
examples: Palm fronds rustled in the gentle tropical breeze
The fern's delicate fronds unfurled in early spring

definitions: part or side that normally faces forward or is most prominent
boundary between two different air masses causing weather changes
outward appearance or manner used to conceal true feelings or situation
examples: The front of the building featured classical architectural elements
She stood at the front of the classroom addressing students
A cold front will bring storms tomorrow evening
The weather front moved eastward across the continent
His confident front masked deep personal insecurities
The business was a front for illegal gambling operations

definitions: front of a building especially the extent of front facing a street
examples: The shop had twenty feet of prime street frontage
Properties with waterfront frontage command premium prices here

definitions: direct and forceful attack or approach from the front
relating to the front part especially the forehead bone
examples: The general ordered a frontal assault at dawn
Their frontal approach to negotiations proved unsuccessful
The frontal bone protects the brain's anterior portion
Brain scans showed activity in the frontal cortex
